member.name: T:WebGrid.Grid
member.summary: WebGrid.Grid web control creates browser-friendly HTML and uses (CSS) Cascading GridStyle Sheet for the layout. WebGrid can display nearly all kinds of database records from a data source by setting a few properties and you create advanced application features by using the existing events () Webgrid contains.
member.remarks: WebGrid is is using Anthem.NET which is a FREE, cross-browser AJAX toolkit for the ASP.NET development environment that works with both ASP.NET 1.1 and 2.0. Please look at WebGrid starter kit for more information about using Anthem.NET

member.summary: Gets a collections of all the errors generated by the grid.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Grid.SystemMessageCritical
member.summary: Gets or sets the error you want to be displayed when a critical event occur. As default WebGrid will render a userfriendly critical message on the web page, this message can by replaced by this property. If you need to debug your web application please see WebGrid.Grid.Debug and for further debug information you can set the property "trace" at your aspx page equal true. Web.Config key for this property is "WG" + property name.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Grid.SystemMessageDelete
member.summary: Gets or sets the error you want to be displayed when a record is deleted from your data source. This message is displayed as error for the instance of the WebGrid.Grid Web.Config key for this property is "WG" + property name.
member.remarks: By default the message for this property is empty and will not be displayed, and the message is only displayed if there are no other errors being generated.
member.value: The message you want to be displayed when a record is deleted from your data source.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Grid.SystemMessageInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets the error you want to be displayed when a new record is inserted into your data source. This message is displayed as error for the instance of the WebGrid.Grid Web.Config key for this property is "WG" + property name.
member.remarks: By default the message for this property is empty and will not be displayed, and the message is only displayed if there are no other errors being generated.
member.value: The message you want to be displayed when a new record is inserted into the data source.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Grid.SystemMessageUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the error you want to be displayed when a record is updated in your data source. This message is displayed as error for the instance of the WebGrid.Grid Web.Config key for this property is "WG" + property name.
member.remarks: By default the message for this property is empty and will not be displayed, and the message is only displayed if there are no other errors being generated.
member.value: The message you want to be displayed when a record is updated in your data source.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Grid.SystemMessageUpdateRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the error you want to be displayed when records has been updated in grid mode. This message is displayed as error for the instance of the WebGrid.Grid Web.Config key for this property is "WG" + property name.
member.remarks: By default the message for this property is empty and will not be displayed, and the message is only displayed if there are no other errors being generated.
member.value: The message you want to be displayed when records is updated in grid mode.

member.name: T:WebGrid.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
WebGrid Datagrid and database tool for ASP.NET by Olav Christian Botterli. WebGrid has an easy-to-use DataGrid and extended database tools for web applications and data source usage. WebGrid.Grid is a web control to display and edit data-tables from a data source , and the namespace contains developer tools to fast create advanced features for your applications.
Getting Started Description
WebGrid.GridBefore getting started using WebGrid learn what WebGrid can do for you with it's properties.
WebGrid.ColumnsSee all the column types (data types) WebGrid support and what properties they possess.
WebGrid.EventsSee what events you can use on WebGrid.Grid and see how you can have full control over your data source is being rendered to the web page.
InsertUpdateThis is a powerful and easy-to-use tool to update your data source in a secure and easy way. (Recommended!)
QueryThis is a powerful and easy-to-use tool to query your data source in a secure and easy way. (Recommended!)

member.summary: Sets or gets data source for this column, as default columns are using same data source as the grid." With WebGrid you can, if you have the proper permissions, access other databases from your data-source. One such example is microsoft's NorthWind database that can be accessed like this to read the table labeled Customers: [NorthWind].dbo.[Customers]
member.remarks: See the columns 'DataSourcePrimaryKeys'

member.name: P:WebGrid.Columns.Column.TextTruncate
member.summary: TextTruncate the text when it exceeds a certain number of characters. It truncates at whole words and ends with ' ..'. A truncated text will be clickable by default. The truncated text can be made non-clickable by setting 'linkfield = false' for this column.
member.remarks: This property is disabled if the value is less than 1. This property applies only to grid mode.

member.summary: Sets or gets if this column should span over all rows in grid mode.
member.value: true if [use all rows]; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is by default false, except for Image columns that have a RecordsPerRow value that is larger than one.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Columns.Column.ValidExpression
member.summary: Sets or gets a regular or logical expression for the column. This applies for columns that allow updating. It will automatically detect type of expression (logical or regular).
member.remarks: Remember that logical expression use '==' for 'equals', not '='. (A single '=' is used to assign new values.) Logical expression can also get column values by writing column names surrounded by brackets. Example: "([fromcolumn] > [todatecolumn])"

member.name: P:WebGrid.Columns.Column.DefaultValue

member.summary: HTML Template for WebGrid Columns, if set it will render the content of this instead of the Value of the content. Create dynamic content by referring to columnId soroundded by [ and ] an example of dynamic content is: "Hi my first name is [FirstName]"

member.remarks: Lower number equals higher priority.

member.name: T:WebGrid.Collections.SystemMessageCollection
member.summary: A collection of errors that are generated by WebGrid.Grid. There are two types of systemMessages; "critical error" and "Error". A "critical error" is caused by an internal system error and will abort the current evaluation and display a message with details about the systemMessage. "Error" is displayed in the application to inform the user of a certain event that the user triggered. A typical example of such an event is when data input from the user is invalid.

member.name: T:WebGrid.Util.Sms
member.summary: this class contains WebGrid Sms (Short Message Service) service for sending messages of up to 160 characters in each message to mobile phones that use Global System for Mobile (GSM) communication. Webgrid Sms service uses clicktell (http://clickatell.com) as service provider for sending Sms messages around the world. out Sms network supports more then 180 countries, and we support outgoing non-premium Sms messages. Non-premium messages is free of charge for the receiver. If you need access to this service please use the contact form at http://www.webgrid.com, and state your request there.
member.remarks: To access WebGrid Sms Service you must have a customerId and password, by this information you can use class to access WebGrid Sms Service Network. you can also access your account at http://sms.webgrid.com and login into your account and view credit balance and message archive. When you send an Sms message you will be charged by credits, and soon as your account hits zero credits your will loose access to WebGrid Sms Service Network. Credits can be bought at http://sms.webgrid.com.

member.name: M:WebGrid.Util.Sms.SendSms(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.UploadDataCompletedEventHandler,System.Object)
member.summary: Method to access WebGrid Sms Service and sending out sms asynchronously (threadpool), to access this service you must provide a customerId and password. For further information please read documentation at . This method support also Web.Config to access customerId and password information for WebGrid Sms the web.config keys are "WGSMSCUSTOMERID" and "WGSMSPASSWORD".
member.param: Sender address, must be alfanumeric string with no more then 11 characters and no special characters.
The receivers cellphone number, can be Separated by ";" and all numbers must be written with international number. See documentation for further information.
The message you want to send. All messages with more then 160 characters will be split.
The user token for this message
member.remarks: Using the receiver parameter you must include country number, area number, and local number. Example could be "4712345678", where "47" is the norwegian country code and 12345678 is area and local number.

member.name: M:WebGrid.Util.Sms.internalSendSms(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.UploadDataCompletedEventHandler,System.Object)
member.summary: Method to access WebGrid Sms Service. Internal use only..
member.param: Sender address, must be alfanumeric string with no more then 11 characters and no special characters.
The receivers cellphone number, can be Separated by ";" and all numbers must be written with international number. See documentation for further information.
The message you want to send. All messages with more then 160 characters will be split.
member.remarks: Using the receiver parameter you must include country number, area number, and local number. Example could be "4712345678", where "47" is the norwegian country code and 12345678 is area and local number. Any errors are logged at Windows EventLog (Application category).

member.summary: The customerId provided by the WebGrid Sms Service.

member.summary: Encrypts a string using a key.

member.returns: The encrypted text.

member.summary: Generates a license key based on the supplied index key.

member.summary: Verifies a licensekey based on the supplied index key.

member.summary: Verifies a licensekey based on the supplied index key.

The code supplied by the user.

member.name: M:WebGrid.Util.Security.Decrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,WebGrid.Util.Security.HashAlgorithm,System.Int32,WebGrid.Util.Security.KeySize)
member.SUMMARY: Decrypts specified ciphertext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm.
member.PARAM: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.REMARKS: Most of the logic in this function is similar to the Encrypt logic. In order for decryption to work, all parameters of this function - except cipherText value - must match the corresponding parameters of the Encrypt function which was called to generate the ciphertext.

member.name: M:WebGrid.Util.Security.Encrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,WebGrid.Util.Security.HashAlgorithm,System.Int32,WebGrid.Util.Security.KeySize)
member.SUMMARY: This class uses a symmetric key algorithm (Rijndael/AES) to encrypt and decrypt data. As long as encryption and decryption routines use the same parameters to generate the keys, the keys are guaranteed to be the same. The class uses static functions with duplicate code to make it easier to demonstrate encryption and decryption logic. In a real-life application, this may not be the most efficient way of handling encryption, so - as soon as you feel comfortable with it - you may want to redesign this class.
Encrypts specified plaintext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm and returns a base64-encoded result.
member.PARAM: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.RETURNS: Encrypted value formatted as a base64-encoded string.

member.name: T:WebGrid.Columns.ManyToMany
member.summary: The ManyToMany class is displayed as a column with two or more check boxes in the web interface. Many-to-many relationships occur where, for each instance of table A, there are many instances of table B, and for each instance of table B, there are many instances of the table A. For example, a poetry anthology can have many authors, and each author can appear in many poetry anthologies. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.summary: Sets or gets the column grid Alias for an unchecked checkbox. Default is null (nothing). An unchecked checkbox normally being rendered with this column type can be replaced by the string provided. (This string can also be html.)
member.value: The text/HTML to display when unchecked.

member.summary: Sets or gets an column grid Alias for a checked checkbox. The default is null (nothing). A checked checkbox normally being rendered with this column type can be replaced by the string provided. (This string can also be HTML.)
member.value: The text/HTML to display when checked.

member.name: P:WebGrid.Columns.ManyToMany.Where
member.summary: Sets or gets a filter for the data source. "WHERE" should not be written. Only the statement.
member.remarks: Sets or gets a filter for the data source. "WHERE" should not be written. Only the statement. If your data source contains more then one table, the 'where'-statement might require you to include both table name and table field. Example: [Customers].[CustomerId] Where Customers is table name and CustomerId is table field.

member.summary: Sets or gets whether the column is using a WYSIWYG (default size is 400x500 pixels) html-grid for input. Default is false. This property requires an MSHTML object for your browser (Will return false if internet explorer 5.5 or later is not used.)

member.summary: Defines what type of column should be displayed.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Unknown
member.summary: The UnknownColumn class is displayed as a column with a free text input box in the web interface.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Checkbox
member.summary: The Checkbox class is displayed as a column with a checkbox in the web interface. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Chart
member.summary: The Chart class is displayed as an image (graph) in the web interface. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class. The Chart column is only presentable in grid mode, and uses rowspan equal to the number of records visibility on the screen.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.DateTime
member.summary: The DateTime class is displayed as a column with a free text input box in the web interface. Normally a calendar icon is shown next to the input box (if the column is editable). This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Decimal
member.summary: The Decimal class is displayed as a column with a free text inputbox in the web interface. This column automatically validates all user input and allows most float values. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Foreignkey
member.summary: The Foreign key class is displayed as a column with a dropdown box by default (radio buttons is also available). With huge data-load for the Foreign key column this can be rendered as a search-box where the data is being cached. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.File
member.summary: The Image class is displayed as a column with a file inputbox in the web interface. If the column contains a file it can be displayed as an image or a hyperlink. The file can either be stored on disk or in the data source (if available). This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Image
member.summary: The Image class is displayed as a column with a file inputbox in the web interface. If the column contains a file it can be displayed as an image or a hyperlink. The file can either be stored on disk or in the data source (if available). This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Number
member.summary: The Integer class is displayed as a column with a free text inputbox in the web interface. This column automatically validates all user input and allows most numerical values. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.ManyToMany
member.summary: The ManyToMany class is displayed as a column with two or more check boxes in the web interface. Many-to-many relationships occur where, for each instance of table A, there are many instances of table B, and for each instance of table B, there are many instances of the table A. For example, a poetry anthology can have many authors, and each author can appear in many poetry anthologies. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.SystemColumn
member.summary: The SystemColumn class is displayed as a column with various layout in the web interface. The SystemColumns are columns used by WebGrid. The most common columns are "edit record" and "delete record" columns. An Enumeration list is available at WebGrid.Enums.SystemColumn. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.Text
member.summary: The Text class is displayed as a column with a free text inputbox in the web interface. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.GridColumn
member.summary: The Text class is displayed as a column with a free text inputbox in the web interface. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.name: F:WebGrid.Enums.ColumnType.ColumnTemplate
member.summary: The Text class is displayed as a column with a free text input box in the web interface. This class inherits from the WebGrid.Columns.Column class.

member.summary: Reformats the data in the column from one type to another.

members.member:
Use a mathematical expression to display the value for this column. Other columns in the expression should be represented by the name property surrounded by [ and ]. Example: "3*(3+4)/(5*2) or "([mnyCost]*[intQuantity])" This property applies to grid mode.
